summary: The Ending Trading and Holdings in Congressional Stocks (ETHICS) Act aims to prevent members of Congress, their spouses, and dependent children from trading or owning stocks. It mandates the placement of covered investments in qualified blind trusts, with detailed definitions of 'covered investments' and 'covered persons,' and outlines reporting requirements, enforcement mechanisms (including civil penalties), and exemptions. The bill also amends the STOCK Act related to financial disclosures and reporting and has a severability clause.
